s.text: Pursuant to section 801(a)(2)(A) of title 5, United States Code, this is our report on two major rules promulgated by Department of Agriculture, Federal Crop Insurance Corporation, entitled "Catastrophic Risk Protection Endorsement" and "General Administrative Regulations; Federal Crop Insurance Reform Act of 1994, Regulations for Implementation" (RIN: 0563-AB11).

Pursuant to section 801(a)(2)(A) of title 5, United States Code, this is our report on two major rules promulgated by Department of Agriculture, Federal Crop Insurance Corporation, entitled "Catastrophic Risk Protection Endorsement" and "General Administrative Regulations; Federal Crop Insurance Reform Act of 1994, Regulations for Implementation" (RIN: 0563-AB11).

Pursuant to section 801(a)(2)(A) of title 5, United States Code, this is our report on two major rules promulgated by Department of Agriculture, Federal Crop Insurance Corporation, entitled "Catastrophic Risk Protection Endorsement" and "General Administrative Regulations; Federal Crop Insurance Reform Act of 1994, Regulations for Implementation" (RIN: 0563-AB11).

Pursuant to section 801(a)(2)(A) of title 5, United States Code, this is our report on two major rules promulgated by Department of Agriculture, Federal Crop Insurance Corporation, entitled "Catastrophic Risk Protection Endorsement" and "General Administrative Regulations; Federal Crop Insurance Reform Act of 1994, Regulations for Implementation" (RIN: 0563-AB11).
The Government benefits from a single disaster protection program, as opposed to the previous ad hoc disaster programs, and reduced Federal outlays.
The costs and benefits discussed in the analysis consider both rules.
